data.inputDescription: Choose your data input method to start your data analysis journey

data.distributionHint: Select the statistical distribution you want to generate, the system will automatically generate 1000 random data points
data.useHintDesc: Click any distribution type button, and the system will generate 1000 random data points with default parameters. You can view the statistical properties of the data in the analysis results.
data.aiGenerateDesc: Based on advanced machine learning algorithms, intelligently generate datasets that conform to statistical distribution characteristics
data.generatedHighQuality: Generated {{count}} high-quality data points conforming to statistical distribution characteristics
data.sampleSizeDesc: Number of data points to generate

hypothesis.title: Hypothesis Testing
hypothesis.twoSampleTTest: Two-sample t-test for difference in means
hypothesis.twoSidedComparisonDesc: A two-sided test compares the sample statistic with the null hypothesis value to test whether the sample differs significantly from the null value.
hypothesis.sampleDiffersFromNull: Sample differs significantly from null value
hypothesis.sampleNotDiffersFromNull: Sample does not differ significantly from null value
hypothesis.nullValueInCI: Null value is within confidence interval, supports failing to reject null hypothesis
hypothesis.nullValueNotInCI: Null value is not within confidence interval, supports rejecting null hypothesis
hypothesis.comparisonDataDesc: The comparison data for two-sided test includes:
hypothesis.sampleMeanDesc: Sample mean, calculated from actual data
hypothesis.nullValueDesc: Null hypothesis value, the reference value to test against
hypothesis.differenceDesc: Difference between sample mean and null hypothesis value
hypothesis.adjustNullValueHint: Modifying this value will recalculate the test results
hypothesis.clickOrDragSecondFile: Click or drag second data file
hypothesis.uploadSecondDataHint: Supports CSV or TXT format, one value per line

analysis.title: Data Analysis Results
analysis.description: In-depth analysis of your data characteristics and statistical properties

settings.title: Settings
settings.darkDesc: Eye-friendly dark theme, suitable for long-term use
settings.lightDesc: Fresh light interface, suitable for bright environments

ai.title: AI Data Analysis Assistant
ai.configuringDesc: Click the "Settings" button in the top right corner to enter your API key
ai.error: API configuration is incomplete or invalid
ai.errorDesc: Please check your API key in settings
ai.chatHint: You can ask any questions about data analysis, such as:

api.title: Aliyun API Configuration
api.apiKeyPlaceholder: Please enter your Aliyun API Key
api.tip1: Please ensure you have enabled the large model service on Aliyun official website
api.tip2: Only API Key is needed to connect to Aliyun DashScope API
api.tip3: API Key is only saved in your local browser and will not be uploaded to any server
api.tip4: To modify saved configuration, re-enter and click save button

statisticsGuide.title: Statistics Guide
statisticsGuide.description: Understanding core statistical concepts in data analysis
statisticsGuide.quickNavDesc: Click any concept card to view detailed explanation, or hover for quick tips. Each statistic has its unique mathematical meaning and application scenarios.

mean.title: Mean
mean.description: Arithmetic average of all data points
mean.details: Mean is the most basic measure of central tendency, representing the average level of data. For normally distributed data, mean, median and mode are equal.

median.title: Median
median.description: Value at the middle position after sorting
median.details: Median is the value at the middle after sorting data. It is not sensitive to outliers and better reflects the center position of data than mean.

stdDev.title: Standard Deviation
stdDev.details: Standard deviation reflects the degree of variation in data. Larger standard deviation means more dispersed data; smaller standard deviation means more concentrated data.

variance.title: Variance
variance.description: Square of standard deviation, measuring data variability
variance.details: Variance is the square of standard deviation, used to measure the degree of data dispersion. It has important applications in statistical inference.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Most frequently occurring value in the dataset
mode.details: Mode is the most frequently occurring value in data. A dataset may have multiple modes or no mode.

skewness.title: Skewness
skewness.details: Skewness measures the degree of distribution skewness. Positive values indicate right skew (long tail on right), negative values indicate left skew (long tail on left).

kurtosis.title: Kurtosis
kurtosis.details: Kurtosis describes the relative steepness of distribution tails. Positive values indicate thicker tails, negative values indicate thinner tails.

appInfo.aboutDesc: Data Analyst Web App provides modern data analysis experience, supporting multiple statistical methods and AI-assisted analysis.

advanced.title: Advanced Statistical Features and Distribution Analysis
advanced.notNormalDist: Data does not follow normal distribution (p < 0.05)
advanced.jbDesc: Normality test based on skewness and kurtosis, suitable for large samples
advanced.swDesc: Normality test based on ranked data, suitable for small to medium samples
advanced.confidenceIntervalTitle: Confidence Intervals for Skewness and Kurtosis (95%)
advanced.hoverMode: Mode is the most frequently occurring value in the dataset, which can have multiple or none.
advanced.hoverSkewness: Skewness describes the degree of tilt in distribution shape, affecting data analysis and modeling.
advanced.hoverKurtosis: Kurtosis reflects the relative steepness of distribution tails, affecting risk assessment.
advanced.hoverDistribution: Distribution type automatically identified based on skewness and kurtosis, helping understand data characteristics.

confidence.title: Confidence Intervals
confidence.twoSampleMeanDiff: Confidence Interval for Difference in Two Sample Means
confidence.pairedMeanDiff: Confidence Interval for Paired Sample Mean Difference
confidence.twoProportionDiff: Confidence Interval for Difference in Two Proportions
confidence.pairedErrorDesc: Paired data must have the same sample size

parameter.momDesc: Method of Moments - Sample moment-based estimation method
parameter.comparisonDesc: Compare differences between MLE and MoM, two classic parameter estimation methods
parameter.mlePrinciple: Maximum Likelihood Estimation estimates parameters by finding parameter values that are most likely to produce observed data. It is based on probability theory, seeking parameters Œ∏ that maximize the likelihood function L(Œ∏|x) = ‚àè f(x·µ¢|Œ∏).
parameter.momPrinciple: Method of Moments estimates parameters by matching sample moments with theoretical moments. It sets sample moments equal to theoretical moments, then solves the parameter equations.

power.title: Power Analysis and Sample Size Calculation
power.currentPower: Under current parameters, test power is {power}%
power.rejectProb: This means when the alternative hypothesis is true, the probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis is {power}%
power.highPower: High Power (>80%): Test can detect effects well
power.mediumPower: Medium Power (60-80%): Test has moderate ability to detect effects
power.lowPower: Low Power (<60%): Test has difficulty detecting effects, may need larger sample size
power.reachPower: To achieve {power}% test power with significance level {alpha}
power.detectEffect: To detect differences with effect size {effect}
power.minSampleSize: Minimum sample size required is {size} observations
power.sampleSizeTip1: Larger sample size increases test power and can detect smaller effects
power.sampleSizeTip2: Lower significance level requires larger sample size
power.sampleSizeTip3: Higher target power requires larger sample size
power.sampleSizeTip4: Larger effect size requires smaller sample size

rohe.title: ROHE Analysis Results
rohe.recommendation1: Heteroscedasticity detected, recommend using robust statistical methods or variance stabilizing transformations
rohe.recommendation2: Low data robustness, recommend checking data quality or using robust statistical methods
rohe.recommendation3: High outlier proportion, recommend further investigation of data distribution characteristics
rohe.recommendation4: ROHE analysis provides comprehensive assessment of data heteroscedasticity and robustness

dataInput.subtitle: Data Input
dataInput.item1: CSV File Upload: Click the file upload area to select your data file
dataInput.item2: Distribution Data Generation: Select a probability distribution, system will automatically generate corresponding data
dataInput.item3: AI Data Generation: Click "Generate Data" button to get AI-generated sample data

analysis.subtitle: Data Analysis
analysis.item1: Basic Statistical Analysis: View statistical indicators like mean, median, standard deviation
analysis.item2: MLE/MoM Analysis: Understand results comparison of different parameter estimation methods
analysis.item3: Data Visualization: Visually understand data distribution through histograms and scatter plots

export.subtitle: Export Results
export.item1: Screenshot Save: Use system screenshot function to save analysis results
export.item2: Data Sharing: Export processed data for use in other applications

indicators.subtitle: Statistical Indicator Explanation
indicators.item1: Mean: Measure of central tendency of data
indicators.item2: Median: Middle value after sorting data, not affected by extreme values
indicators.item3: Standard Deviation: Measure of data dispersion

distributions.subtitle: Distribution Type Characteristics
distributions.item1: Normal Distribution: Symmetric bell curve, suitable for many natural phenomena
distributions.item2: Uniform Distribution: All values have equal probability
distributions.item3: Exponential Distribution: Often used to describe time intervals between events
distributions.item4: Poisson Distribution: Used to describe number of events in fixed time period

estimation.subtitle: Parameter Estimation Methods
estimation.item1: Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE): Widely used method in statistical inference
estimation.item2: Method of Moments (MoM): Simple calculation but lower precision in some cases

config.subtitle: Configure Aliyun API
config.item1: Go to Aliyun official website to enable large model service
config.item2: Get your API Key and API Secret
config.item3: Configure API key information in the application

tips.subtitle: Questioning Tips
tips.item1: Ask specific questions: e.g. "Does my data follow normal distribution?"
tips.item2: Request suggestions: e.g. "Based on these statistical results, what analysis method should I use?"
tips.item3: Request explanations: e.g. "How to interpret skewness and kurtosis values?"

faq.subtitle: Common Issues
faq.item1: API call failure: Check network connection and key configuration
faq.item2: Long response time: Large model processing takes time, please be patient
faq.item3: Unsatisfactory results: Try adjusting question phrasing

upload.subtitle: File Upload Issues
upload.item1: File format error: Ensure uploaded file is CSV format
upload.item2: Data parsing failure: Check if CSV file format meets requirements
upload.item3: File size limit: Recommend uploading no more than 100,000 data points at once

results.subtitle: Analysis Result Issues
results.item1: Abnormal results: Check if data contains outliers or missing values
results.item2: Chart display issues: Try refreshing page or using latest browser version
results.item3: Calculation errors: Ensure input data types are correct

performance.subtitle: Performance Optimization
performance.item1: Large datasets: May require longer processing time for large datasets
performance.item2: Browser compatibility: Recommend using latest versions of Chrome, Firefox or Edge
performance.item3: Cache cleanup: Regularly clear browser cache for best experience

fileError.title: File parsing error:
fileError.message: File parsing error, please ensure uploaded file is a valid CSV file.
fileError.aiMock: AI data generation feature: This is mock data, actual applications should connect to AI API.

statisticsCard.meanTooltip: Arithmetic mean, representing central position of data
statisticsCard.medianTooltip: Value at middle position after sorting, not sensitive to outliers
statisticsCard.varianceTooltip: Square of standard deviation, measuring data variability
